2303420.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303420
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 001
2303420.text: Ibn 'Awn reported, "They used to say, 'Do not honour your guest in a way which will be burdensome for him.'"

2303430.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303430
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 002
2303430.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "When a man visits his brothers, Allah tells him, 'You have been good and your evening will be good and you can take your place in the Garden.'"

2303440.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303440
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 003
2303440.text: Umm ad-Darda' said, "Salman came from al-Mada'in (Ctesiphon) to Syria to visit us on foot wearing a shirt (kisa') and trousers." Shawdhab said, "Salman was seen wearing a short with all his hair shaved off and his large ears showing. He was told, 'You have made yourself ugly.' He replied, "The real good is the good of the Next World.'"

2303450.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303450
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 004
2303450.text: Anas ibn Malik reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, visited one of the houses of the Ansar and ate some food with them. When he left, he asked for a place in the house and some water was sprinkled on a carpet for him. He prayed on it and made supplication for them.

2303461.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303461
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 005
2303461.text: 'Abdulkarim Abu Umuyyah came to Abu Al'aliyah and on him were wool clothes. So Abu Al'aliyah said "These are but the clothes of monks, as the Muslims, when visiting each other, would beautify themselves."

2303462.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303462
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 006
2303462.text: 'Abdullah, the client of Asma', said, "Asma' brought out to me a cloak of Tayalisah (a type of mantle) which had a collar border a span (wide) of brocade and verily it's two openings were hemmed with it (i.e. brocade). She said, 'This is the of the cloak of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. He used to wear it for delegations and on Jumu'a.' "

2303470.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303470
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 007
2303470.text: 'Abdullah ibn 'Umar said, "'Umar found a silk robe and brought it to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and said, 'Buy this and wear it on Jumu'ah and when delegations come to you.' The Prophet, peace be upon him, replied, 'Only someone who has no portion in the Next World wears this.' Then the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was brought some robes and sent one robe to 'Umar, one to Usama, and one to 'Ali. 'Umar said, 'Messenger of Allah! You have sent this to me when I heard you say what you said about it.' The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, 'You can sell it or take care of your needs with it.'"

2303480.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303480
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 008
2303480.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "A man visited a brother of his in a village, so Allah put an angel in wait for him on the road. He asked, 'Where are you going?' He replied, 'To a brother of mine in this village.' He said, 'Is he responsible for some blessing you have?' He said, 'No, I love him for Allah.' He said, 'I am a messenger of Allah to you. Allah loves you as you love him.'"

2303490.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303490
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 009
2303490.text: Abu Dharr said, "I asked, 'Messenger of Allah, what if a man loves a people but cannot join them?' He replied, 'Abu Dharr, you are with the one you love.' I said, 'I love Allah and His Messenger.' He said, 'Abu Dharr, you are with the one you love.'"

2303500.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303500
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 010
2303500.text: Anas reported that a man asked the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, "Prophet of Allah, when will the Final Hour come?" He said, "Have you not made preparation for it?" He replied, " I am not prepared for a terrible event , but I love Allah and His Messenger." He said, "A man is with the one he loves."
